nodes.bodyText: This test class already has too many scenarios in it - let's make a new "WriteDataWithUriTemplateTest" to capture all of these tests. Makes it easy to see all the test coverage for this feature.
I don't think the endpoint should have knowledge of this - let generateUri check to see if uriTemplate is specified or not.
I want to mention that if I do that RegExp inside the generateURI then we do that e.g. 200 times (or what the batch size is) instead of once

Good point, I didn't catch that. I'd still like to keep the generateUri function args as "record, endpointConstant". What do you think of this:

The endpoint will check for uriTemplate, and if it exists, it will add "uriTemplateRegex" to endpointConstants
The generateUri function will check for "uriTemplateRegex", then for "uriTemplate" (and if uriTemplate exists, it will construct a regex for it)

That allows for the optimization without complicating the interface of generateUri. Thoughts?
This is an excellent idea. Ready for commit

Is this for the temporal use case, where we don't want the URI to be included in the list of collections if we're doing a temporal insert? Let's leave that out of this PR, it should be in a separate ticket that includes a test to ensure the URI is discarded.
Sorry that was intended for the temporal case but placed under the wrong IF branch
I think you need to test for "array" as well?

For the error messages, we want to have strict control over the HTTP response code. So import ds-util.sjs and do the following:
ds.throwBadRequest("uriTemplate " + uriTemplate + " cannot be applied; property '" + group + "' is null");
Just do a revert on this file so that there are no changes to it
